Package mainCalculatorPackage

Class CalculatorValue

  • java.lang.Object
    • uNumberLibrary.UNumber
      • mainCalculatorPackage.CalculatorValue
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<UNumber>
    public class CalculatorValue
extends UNumber

    Title: CalculatorValue Class.

    Description: A component of a JavaFX demonstration application that performs computations

    Copyright: Lynn Robert Carter Â© 2017

    Version:
    4.10 2018-01-15 The implementation of integer subtraction, multiplication and division is done., 4.20 2018-02-02 The Square Root method initialized with change in error meassages., 4.30 2018-02-25 Implementation of FSM to provide high quality error messages., 4.40 2018-03-15 Implementation of error terms calculation and respective high quality error Messages., 4.50 2018-04-13 Implementation of Estimated Measured Values and Error Terms with respect to digits of significance., 5.10 2018-10-04 Implementation of UNumber Library to provide unlimited precision. Currently the precision is set to 25 significant digits., 5.20 2018-11-22 Implementation of Unit Support System with Signal Normalization as well as Inter-Conversion of Units of Same Physical Dimensions. Version 5.20 is designed and implemented keeping Hohmann Transfer Equations and Respective Calculations in consideration., 6.00 2019-02-24 Implemented in the Programmable Calculator V1
    Author:
    Lynn Robert Carter, JSGREWAL, Sumit and Shivam

      • lookupTableForConversion

        public static java.lang.String[][] lookupTableForConversion
        This is the Lookup Table Which serves as a mapping between two units and the factors which needs to be multiplied in order to perform the mapped conversion.

      • conversionPossibilityMapping

        public static boolean[][] conversionPossibilityMapping
        This is the matrix which resembles the Lookup Table and maps the possibility of the conversion of units with the respective units. true means that the conversion defined by the index of the value is physically possible.

      • theListOfUnits

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> theListOfUnits

      • CalculatorValue

        public CalculatorValue​(java.lang.String s)
        This constructor creates a calculator value from a string... Due to the nature of the input, there is a high probability that the input has errors, so the routine returns the value with the error message value set to empty or the string of an error message.

      • CalculatorValue

        public CalculatorValue​(java.lang.String s,
                       java.lang.String e,
                       java.lang.String u)
        This constructor creates a calculator value from two strings... Due to the nature of the input, there is a high probability that the input has errors, so the routine returns the value with the error message value set to empty or the string of an error message.

        unit -

      • checkMeasureValue

        public static java.lang.String checkMeasureValue​(java.lang.String input)
        This method is a mechanical transformation of a Finite State Machine diagram into a Java method for Measured Values.
        Parameters:
        input - The input string for the Finite State Machine
        Returns:
        An output string that is empty if every things is okay or it will be a string with a help description of the error follow by two lines that shows the input line follow by a line with an up arrow at the point where the error was found.

      • checkErrorTerm

        public static java.lang.String checkErrorTerm​(java.lang.String input)
        This method is a mechanical transformation of a Finite State Machine diagram into a Java method for Error Terms.
        Parameters:
        input - The input string for the Finite State Machine
        Returns:
        An output string that is empty if every things is okay or it will be a string with a help description of the error follow by two lines that shows the input line follow by a line with an up arrow at the point where the error was found.

      • convertResultantUnit

        public static void convertResultantUnit​(java.lang.String lastUnit,
                                        java.lang.String newUnit)
        The following method converts the resultant values according to the unit change governed by choice of the user. Unlike performNormalization() method, this routine uses UNumber library to compute the resultant values.
        Parameters:
        lastUnit - Unit that is supposed to be converted.
        newUnit - Changed / Converted Unit
